image.caption: Black clouds hang over the Bangabandhu national stadium in Dhaka
image.longCaption: Black clouds hang over Banghabandhu nation stadium in Dhaka as the pitch is covered with plastic 20 April 2003. South African and India are to play the final match of the TVS tri-nation cricket tournament, but heavy rain stopped the match before it could start

milestones.description: Otieno has broken the record for most sixes (12) in ODIs for KENYA, going past Odumbe's 10
Akram Khan has become the top scorer for BAN in ODIs with 571 runs, going past Aminul Islam's 548
Otieno has become the top scorer for KENYA in ODIs with 744 runs, going past Steve Tikolo's 688
Otieno has scored 2 hundreds in ODIs, the most for KENYA breaking Chudasama's record
Otieno has broken the record for most sixes in an innings (6) in ODIs for KENYA, going past Odumbe's 5
Otieno has broken the record for most runs in boundaries (68) in an innings in ODIs for KENYA, going past Chudasama's 64
Akram Khan has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (25) for BAN, going past Aminul Islam
Aasif Karim has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (24) for KENYA, going past Hitesh Modi

recentMatches.title: 6th Match
recentMatches.statusText: Zimbabwe won by 3 wickets (with 3 balls remaining)

image.caption: Black clouds hang over the Bangabandhu national stadium in Dhaka
image.longCaption: Black clouds hang over Banghabandhu nation stadium in Dhaka as the pitch is covered with plastic 20 April 2003. South African and India are to play the final match of the TVS tri-nation cricket tournament, but heavy rain stopped the match before it could start
